task_summary: Detect the T-block, approach and align, then perform repeated leftward pushes to seat the block into the T-shaped target outline, verify alignment, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a planar workspace until it sits inside a T-shaped target outline. The sequence begins with perception to locate the block, followed by a safe overhead approach and fine alignment. The robot executes several incremental pushes along a consistent direction to translate and orient the block toward the target. A brief verification and final nudge complete the placement. Timeouts are moderate to accommodate real motion; the task assumes planar contact and no grasping.
preconditions: T-block present and visible to the camera
Target outline is static and known
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the T-block
Move above and align to the block
Set desired push direction toward the target
Deliver a short final push to seat the block
success_criteria: Block’s footprint lies within the T-shaped outline
No further contact force needed to maintain pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, scan with retries
If alignment drifts, re-approach before pushing
If block stalls, repeat short pushes
Abort if IsAt(goal_region) never becomes true within allotted attempts
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the goal region is reached and the robot has retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Active scan for the block if initial detection fails.
Move to a safe overhead pre-contact pose.
Close in and align the tool for pushing.
Record push direction on the blackboard.
Primary incremental push toward the target.
Align to the target for the final nudge.
Short final push to seat the block.
Verify block is in the goal region.
Back the tool away from the block.
Brief pause to stabilize after completion.

failure_modes: Friction too low/high causing slide or stall
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and realign before continuing pushes
Use smaller push distance for fine control
Abort if goal cannot be verified
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue outline, whereas instruction mentions gray block and green target; we prioritize the frames.
Push direction assumed leftward (180°) based on visual motion.
Planar pushing with a circular tool; no grasping.
10Hz observation/control noted but not directly mapped to specific timeouts.

expected_success_criteria: T-block edges lie within the target outline after final push
No further motion when the tool retreats
